 Notes

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

With a sound equal parts Pearl Jam/Creed grunge-anthemic and Hinder modern/heavy, and a touch of hard-edged Southern rock that betrays their Mississippi origins, 3 Doors Down were a huge success straight out of the gate, and quickly became one of the biggest rock bands in the country. Their fourth album finds them continuing confidently down the path they've established, as Brad Arnold's voice contrasts heavyweight wailing with contemplative near-crooning. Rampaging riff monsters like "Train" rub shoulders with the power balladry of "Your Arms Feel Like Home," as the band's trademark mix of raw energy and melodic pop unfurls itself once more.
